basics.name: Iain Bryson
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Making software across boundaries of language, technology and geography.
highlights: Delivering solid product in orgs ranging from global corporations to startups

work.summary: Built the world's first search engine for graphs & charts from trusted publishers & data sources.
highlights: Architected the product, backend, frontend, deployment and CI/CD pipeline.
Led a team of 2 developers and together we created a responsive, fast chart search engine serving a database of 600k (and growing) charts and infographics to 1000s of users a month.
Built e-Learning Platform for Danish Technical University, including course notes editor and renderer and a quiz system.
Built a research API for accessing public sound data.

work.summary: Gap year, traveling and reinventing myself as a digital nomad.
Principal SDET on OneDrive: file syncing for millions of customers across multiple platforms.
highlights: Implemented telemetry in all areas of the product chain, from backend services through to clients on all platforms.

Write analysis scripts, developed statistical models, creating visualizations & presentations for audiences ranging from senior management to the entire team of ~300 engineers to drive stability and performance.

additionalWork.summary: Test lead on the Client Sync Engine team in the Windows Live Mesh team.  Led a team responsible for testing the file sync engine, validating performance, stress, and functional correctness for the client components of the distributed client service and peer to peer file synchronization engine.  Shipped as part of Windows Live Essentials in 2010.
SDET, Lead & Manager for Visual C++
highlights: Held various management positions, including lead and manager-of-managers
Led testing during the 64-bit transitions of VC++: IA64 and x64; delivered solid compilers to Windows & millions of external customers.
